intro: Fritzschia rupestris, commonly known as the rock bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Fritzschia rupestris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and xeriscaping.
